question: Which amendment to the Constitution of India provides for making of any provision in favour of the SCs and STs for relaxation in qualifying marks in any examination or lowering the standards of evaluation?
explanation: The 82nd Amendment (2000) to the Constitution of India provides for making of any provision in favour of the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes for relaxation in qualifying marks in any examination or lowering the standards of evaluation, for reservation in matters of promotion to the public services of the Centre and the states.
